results.title: The Adventures of Tom Sawyer
results.creator_credit: Norman Taurog, David O. Selznick, William H Wright and Selznick International
results.brief_description: In this story, we meet Tom, his aunt Polly, his cousin Sidney, girlfriend Becky, and his best friend and adviser Huckleberry Finn. Tom seems to be constantly drawn to trouble. His dangerous adventures, schoolboy pranks, and his painful cousin are highlights of this video. Based on the novel of Mark Twain.

results.title: The Unbearable lightness of being
results.creator_credit: Philip Kaufman, Saul Zaentz and Orion Pictures Corporation
results.brief_description: Tomas is a master of seduction. To him women are for pleasure and Sabina is the ultimate, a free spirit like himself. Life is blissfully simple until Tomas meets the young and innocent Tereza who awakens in him a tenderness he never knew possible. But it is 1968 and as the Russian tanks roll into Prague Tomas is forced to make choices; between love of his country and his yearning for freedom, between desire for Sabina and devotion to the ever-faithful Tereza. Adapted from the novel by Milan Kundera, the film stars Daniel Day-Lewis, Juliette Binoche and Lena Olin.

results.title: Tootsie
results.creator_credit: Sydney Pollack, Dick Richards and Mirage Enterprises
results.brief_description: Nobody will hire the rash Michael Dorsey (Dustin Hoffman) because he has antagonised every producer in New York. When his girlfriend fails an audition for a soap opera; Michael dresses up as “Dorothy Michaels” and lands the part. Michael’s sole conspirators are his agent George and his room mate Geoff. All goes well until “Dorothy” falls in love with beautiful co-star Julie (Jessica Lange) - and Julie’s father falls for “Dorothy.” Co-starring Bill Murray, Teri Garr, Charles Durning and Sydney Pollack.

results.title: In which we serve
results.creator_credit: David Lean, Noel Coward and Two Cities Films
results.brief_description: In which we serve is a story of a British destroyer, the H.M.S. Torrin, from its completion to its destruction at sea by the Germans. She is divebombed in the Battle of Crete, but the survivors carry on the fight. Through their experiences are shown the ordeals, the achievements and the gallantry of H.M.S. Torrin. Stars Noel Coward, John Mills, Bernard Miles, Celia Johnson, Michael Wilding and Richard Attenborough.

results.title: The Delinquents (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Chris Thomson, Alex Cutler, Mike Wilcox, Cutler, Silver Lining Entertainment and Wilcox
results.brief_description: Too young to be together, too in love to be apart, Lola and Brownie’s obsessive passion for each other breaks all the rules laid down by their parents and society. Quickly branded as rebels they are forced to separate but they fight all the odds to be reunited. Stars Kylie Minogue, Charlie Schlatter and Angela Punch-McGregor Based on the novel “The Delinquents” by Criena Rohan.

results.title: Sleeper
results.creator_credit: Woody Allen, Jack Grossberg and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description: A witty, futuristic comedy with Allen brought back to life after 200 years in the year 2173 to find himself a wanted man in a totally regulated society. Allen is hunted as a dangerous alien, and in the course of avoiding capture, he first becomes a robot-servant to dippy artist, Diane Keaton, and, after revealing his true identity to her, embarks with her on an hilarious series of improbable escapades.

results.title: Black widow
results.creator_credit: Bob Rafelson, Harold Schneider and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: A fascinating reworking of the film noir genre, with Teresa Russell performing the femme fatale Reni, who seduces then murders a string of unsuspecting men, and Debra Winger taking on the role of the unsatisfied FBI agent Alex. Alex’s investigation is complicated by her increasing obsession with Reni and the sexual tension between the two, which threatens to bring about the downfall of both. A gripping and intricate film that raises interesting questions about love, desire and death.

results.title: Poor Cow
results.creator_credit: Kenneth Loach, Joseph Janni and Anglo Amalgamated
results.brief_description: Scripted by Nell Dunn from her novel, “Poor Cow” is a gritty piece of social realist film-making. A young woman is left pregnant and living in poverty when her husband is taken to jail. She begins a relationship with his best friend but though she attempts to negotiate the radical sexual mores of late-sixties London her lack of material resources, and the two men’s lack of consideration for her own feelings, eventually lead to her unhappiness. Powerfully directed by Ken Loach, “Poor Cow” is often a stinging critique of “swinging London” as seen through the eyes of working class people. With Carol White and Terence Stamp.

results.title: M*A*S*H* = Mash (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Robert Altman, Ingo Preminger, Leon Ericksen, Aspen Productions and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Hailed as one of the best comedies ever made! Army surgeons during the Korean War develop a lunatic lifestyle in order to cope with the everyday horrors encountered in a Mobile Army Surgical Hospital. The film mixes slapstick with tragedy and pokes merciless fun at military pomposity, empty religion and incompetence. It sticks its tongue out at hypocrisy - the same attitudes which have mad the television series so successful. Based on a novel by Richard Hooker, the film stars Donald Sutherland, Elliott Gould and Tom Skerritt.
